com.thisismydesign.managedentity

Class ManagedEntity

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.thisismydesign.managedentity.ManagedEntity

  • public abstract class ManagedEntity
extends java.lang.Object
    This class supports entity management with secondary DB keys (a.k.a. business keys) while also using Ids as primary keys

    Entity classes should extend. See example in test package.

    See Also:
    JPA - The uniqueness dilemma and solution

        public ManagedEntity()

    • Method Detail

      • merge

        public ManagedEntity merge()
        Persists self if no persisted entity with the same secondary keys exists.

        Session is queried from DBAdapter via DBAdapter.getCurrentSession().

        Returns:
        persisted entity

      • merge

        public ManagedEntity merge(org.hibernate.Session session)
        Persists self using provided Session if no persisted entity with the same secondary keys exists.

        Upon ConstraintViolationException Session is queried from DBAdapter via DBAdapter.getCurrentSession().

        Parameters:
        session - Session used to access DB
        Returns:
        persisted entity

      • update

        public ManagedEntity update()
        Updates self if no persisted entity with the same secondary keys is already present.

        Session is queried from DBAdapter via DBAdapter.getCurrentSession().

        Returns:
        persisted entity

      • update

        public ManagedEntity update(org.hibernate.Session session)
        Updates self using provided Session if no persisted entity with the same secondary keys exists.
        Parameters:
        session - Session used to access DB
        Returns:
        persisted entity

      • getEqualsCriteria

        protected abstract java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,?> getEqualsCriteria()
        Get uniqueness criteria of self in a HashMap using Java attribute name as key.

        All child entities must implement it.

        Example implementation: 

         
 @Column(name = "name")
 private String name;

 @Column(name = "group_name")
 private String groupName;

 ...

 protected HashMap<String, ?> getEqualsCriteriaList() {
     HashMap<String, String> criteriaList = new HashMap<>();
     criteriaList.put("name", getName());
     criteriaList.put("groupName", getGroupName());

     return criteriaList;
 }
        Returns:
        uniqueness criteria
